intro: Adenosacme longifolia, commonly known as the slender leaf adenosacme, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its elongated, narrow leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in spring. Adenosacme longifolia is often found in woodland or savanna habitats, where it thrives in partial shade. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
